The following may be noted if a nerve root is compressed (causing cervical radiculopathy):
§muscle {{c1::atrophy (wasting)::increased tone or atrophy}} in the upper extremity following a specific myotomal distribution
§{{c2::abnormal::normal abnormal}} sensation following a specific dermatomal distribution
§{{c3::reduced::increased or reduced}} reflexes in the upper extremity.

The following may be noted if the spinal cord is compressed (causing cervical myelopathy):
§Weakness at the level at and {{c4::below::above or below}} the compression (with or without wasting)
§{{c5::increased::decreased or increased}} tone
§{{c6::increased::decreased or increased}} reflexes ({{c6::hyperreflexia}}) below the level of compression  (ie.  lower extremities.)

-Loss of inhibition from the brain results in increase reflexes and {{c3::increase::increased or decreased}} muscle tone ({{c2::spasticity}})

Lower Motor Neuron (LMN) Injury
-Nerve root injury ({{c1::radiculopathy}}) or peripheral nerve injury
-Loss of innervation to muscle results in reduced or {{c2::loss::increase or loss}} of  reflexes and loss of muscle tone (flaccidity)
-Weakness in the muscles innervated by the nerve root or peripheral nerve
